title: Luminary Tour: Fabricating Fashion (September 6)
hero_caption: Kain Panjang (Hip Wrapper) (detail), mid-20th century. Java. Gift of E. M. Bakwin Indonesian Textile Collection.
short_description:
Luminary are invited to join Melinda Watt, chair and Christa C. Mayer Thurman Curator, to celebrate the artistry and legacy of clothing from around the world in Fabricating Fashion. Featuring decorative fabrics as well as finished garments from the Art Institute’s collection, this presentation shows how the textiles used in clothing serve as powerful means of personal and cultural expression.

Open exclusively to Luminary members, this tour requires advance registration and is limited to 12 participants. The tour lasts approximately 50 minutes.
list_description: Luminary are invited to join Melinda Watt, chair and Christa C. Mayer Thurman Curator, to celebrate the artistry and legacy of clothing from around the world in Fabricating Fashion.
description:
Luminary are invited to join Melinda Watt, chair and Christa C. Mayer Thurman Curator in Textiles, to celebrate the artistry and legacy of clothing from around the world in Fabricating Fashion. Featuring decorative fabrics as well as finished garments from the Art Institute’s collection, this presentation shows how the textiles used in clothing serve as powerful means of personal and cultural expression.

Open exclusively to Luminary members, this tour requires advance registration and is limited to 12 participants. The tour lasts approximately 50 minutes. 

So that you can enjoy your experience safely, all museum visiting policies at the time of the event must be observed.

Contact Us
If you have questions or are interested in learning more about Luminary membership, we’d be delighted to hear from you. Please contact us at (312) 443-3735 or luminary@artic.edu.
